text:
K-pop chart highlights from the K-Pop Hot 100 and more featuring San E, 2NE1, Noel, 2AM, Boyfriend, Trouble Maker and more. By
												

	Jeff Benjamin K-pop rapper San E commands the K-Pop Hot 100 this week, rising above strong competition from 2NE1’s “Missing You,” at No. 2 this week. The 28-year-old earns his first K-Pop No. 1 with his pop-leaning, hip-hop collaboration featuring Sanchez of rap trio Phantom. Upon hearing the news that he topped the chart, San E posted a quick message on his official Facebook page saying, “Thank you father.” “Break Up Dinner” stays consistent with one theme: The lyrics detail San E’s last dinner with a girlfriend; The music video also shows him and his leading lady eating one last meal together — as she tries to eat through tears. Watch the music video below. Explore		
	





		Explore	




















See latest videos, charts and news



See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news  Related		
	

















	
	
		
					BTS' V Drops Two Very Different Remixes of 'Slow Dancing' Solo Single		
	



	12/02/2013 San E at No. 1 means K-pop phenoms 2NE1 and new single “Missing You” settle for the No. 2 slot, earning their third Top 2 hit of 2013. But there’s still hope for the ballad to snag the top slot. As Lee Seung Gi’s record-breaking ballad “Return” proved last year, South Korea’s taste lean towards emotional, slow-tempo tracks during the winter. 2NE1’s “Missing You” won’t be the only winter ballad released this year — look out for seasonal-themed tracks from EXO and Secret too — but it got a head start on its competition after a live premiere at the 2013 Mnet Asian Music Awards (MAMAs). Watch the performance below as the quartet perform their somber 2011 single “Lonely” before moving into “Missing You.” MAMAs 2013: Full Winners List + Video Highlights.  The strong debuts from San E and 2NE1 send last week’s No. 1, Davichi’s “The Letter,” down two spots to No. 3. Scrolling down the chart, quartet group Noel’s “When The Night Comes,” featuring hip-hop heavyweights Dynamic Duo, drops to No. 10 from No. 5 this week. The track off Noel’s latest EP, “Trace,” is a smooth, midtempo track heightened by Noel’s melancholic vocals and rhythmic rapping from Dynamic Duo. The song was composed Choi Kyusung — the producer behind Noel’s past K-Pop No. 1 “I Miss You” — and mastered by Miles Showell from Abbey Road Studio.  The four-member boy band 2AM’s newest single, “Just Stay,” from their latest EP “Nocturne,” debuts at No. 11 this week.  “Just Stay,” put together by Ra.D and d.ear (Real Collabo), is a mellow ballad with soft guitar and piano melodies that expresses a man’s crush on his friend that is suffering from her relationship with another man.  K-Pop on Other Billboard Charts:—YouTube: 2NE1’s “Missing You” debuts at No. 21.—Japan Hot 100: Boy band Boyfriend’s Christmas single “Pinky Santa” debuts at No. 9.—World Albums: Sexy duo Trouble Maker‘s second EP “Chemistry” (featuring the K-Pop Hot 100 No. 1 hit “Now”) debuts at No. 8. title: K-Pop Hot 100: San E Edges Out 2NE1 for No. 1 – Billboard
